partintro.para: MCAL stands for Modular Calendar Access Library.
Libmcal is a C library for accessing calendars. It's written to be very modular, with plugable drivers. MCAL is the calendar equivalent of the IMAP module for mailboxes.

With mcal support, a calendar stream can be opened much like the mailbox stream with the IMAP support. Calendars can be local file stores, remote ICAP servers, or other formats that are supported by the mcal library.
Calendar events can be pulled up, queried, and stored. There is also support for calendar triggers (alarms) and reoccuring events.
With libmcal, central calendar servers can be accessed and used, removing the need for any specific database or local file programming.

To get these functions to work, you have to compile PHP with --with-mcal. That requires the mcal library to be installed. Grab the latest version from http://mcal.chek.com/ and compile and install it.

The following constants are defined when using the MCAL module:
MCAL_SUNDAY, MCAL_MONDAY, MCAL_TUESDAY, MCAL_WEDNESDAY, MCAL_THURSDAY, MCAL_FRIDAY, MCAL_SATURDAY,
MCAL_JANUARY, MCAL_FEBRUARY, MCAL_MARCH, MCAL_APRIL, MCAL_MAY, MCAL_JUNE, MCAL_JULY, MCAL_AUGUGT, MCAL_SEPTEMBER, MCAL_OCTOBER, MCAL_NOVEMBER, and MCAL_DECEMBER.
Most of the functions use an internal event structure that is unique for each stream. This alleviates the need to pass around large objects between functions. There are convenience functions for setting, initializing, and retrieving the event structure values.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Opens up an MCAL connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an MCAL stream on success, false on error.

mcal_open opens up an MCAL connection to the specified calendar store. If the optional options is specified, passes the options to that mailbox also. The streams internal event structure is also initialized upon connection.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Close an MCAL stream

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Closes the given mcal stream.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetches an event from the calendar stream

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_fetch_event fetches an event from the calendar stream specified by id.

Returns an event object consisting of:
int id - ID of that event.
int public - TRUE if the event if public, FALSE if it is private.
string category - Category string of the event.
string title - Title string of the event.
string description - Description string of the event.
int alarm - number of minutes before the event to send an alarm/reminder.
object start - Object containing a datetime entry.
object end - Object containing a datetime entry.
int recur_type - recurrence type
int recur_interval - recurrence interval
datetime recur_endate - recurrence end date
int recur_data - recurrence data
All datetime entries consist of an object that contains:
int year - year
int month - month
int mday - day of month
int hour - hour
int min - minutes
int sec - seconds
int alarm - minutes before event to send an alarm

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return a list of events between two given datetimes

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an array of event ID's that are between the start and end dates, or if just a stream is given, uses the start and end dates in the global event structure.
mcal_list_events function takes in an optional beginning date and an end date for a calendar stream. An array of event id's that are between the given dates or the internal event dates are returned.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Store an event into an MCAL calendar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_store_event Stores the global event into an MCAL calendar for the given stream.
Returns true on success and false on error.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Delete an event from an MCAL calendar

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_delete_event deletes the calendar event specified by the uid.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Turn off an alarm for an event

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_snooze turns off an alarm for a calendar event specified by the uid.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Return a list of events that has an alarm triggered at the given datetime

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns an array of event ID's that has an alarm going off between the start and end dates, or if just a stream is given, uses the start and end dates in the global event structure.
mcal_list_events function takes in an optional beginning date and an end date for a calendar stream. An array of event id's that are between the given dates or the internal event dates are returned.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Initializes a streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_init initializes a streams global event structure. this effectively sets all elements of the structure to 0, or the default settings.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the category of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_category sets the streams global event structure's category to the given string.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the title of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_title sets the streams global event structure's title to the given string.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the description of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_description sets the streams global event structure's description to the given string.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the start date and time of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_start sets the streams global event structure's start date and time to the given values.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the end date and time of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_end sets the streams global event structure's end date and time to the given values.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the alarm of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_alarm sets the streams global event structure's alarm to the given minutes before the event.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the class of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_class sets the streams global event structure's class to the given value. The class is either 0 for public, or 1 for private.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns if the given year is a leap year or not

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_is_leap_year returns 1 if the given year is a leap year, 1 if not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the number of days in the given month

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_days_in_month Returns the number of days in the given month, taking into account if the given year is a leap year or not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns true if the given year, month, day is a valid date

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_date_valid Returns true if the given year, month and day is a valid date, false if not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns true if the given year, month, day is a valid time

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_time_valid Returns true if the given hour, minutes and seconds is a valid time, false if not.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the day of the week of the given date

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_day_of_week returns the day of the week of the given date
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the day of the year of the given date

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_day_of_year returns the day of the year of the given date
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Compares two dates

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_date_compare Compares the two given dates, returns <0, 0, >0 if a<b, a==b, a>b respectively

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the next recurrence of the event

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_next_recurrence returns an object filled with the next date the event occurs, on or after the supplied date. Returns empty date field if event does not occur or something is invalid. Uses weekstart to determine what day is considered the beginning of the week.
Returns true.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the recurrence of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_recur_daily sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccuring on a daily basis, ending at the given date.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the recurrence of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_recur_weekly sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccuring on a weekly basis, ending at the given date.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the recurrence of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_mday sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccuring on a monthly by month day basis, ending at the given date.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the recurrence of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_recur_monthly_wday sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccuring on a monthly by week basis, ending at the given date.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Sets the recurrence of the streams global event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mcal_event_set_recur_yearly sets the streams global event structure's recurrence to the given value to be reoccuring on a yearly basis,ending at the given date .

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns an object containing the current streams event structure

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
mcal_event_fetch_current_stream_event returns the current stream's event structure as an object containing:
int id - ID of that event.
int public - TRUE if the event if public, FALSE if it is private.
string category - Category string of the event.
string title - Title string of the event.
string description - Description string of the event.
int alarm - number of minutes before the event to send an alarm/reminder.
object start - Object containing a datetime entry.
object end - Object containing a datetime entry.
int recur_type - recurrence type
int recur_interval - recurrence interval
datetime recur_endate - recurrence end date
int recur_data - recurrence data
All datetime entries consist of an object that contains:
int year - year
int month - month
int mday - day of month
int hour - hour
int min - minutes
int sec - seconds
int alarm - minutes before event to send an alarm
